se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api

Interface StructureNavigator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultStructureNavigator

    public interface StructureNavigator
    Specification for how to navigate in a File system containing a Project, as well as how to extract data from the file system as required by the Project.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR
      The standard separator char for directories.
      static String PACKAGE_SEPARATOR
      The standard separator for packages.
      static FileFilter POM_FILE_FILTER
      A FileFilter identifying pom.xml files.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Finds the directory of the topmost parent pom within an existing project structure, given a file or directory inside the project structure.
      File getProjectRootDirectory(File fileOrDirectory)
      Finds the root directory of an existing project structure, given a file or directory inside the project structure.
      String getRelativePath(File directory, boolean usePackageSeparator)
      Retrieves the relative path for the supplied directory within the project.

    • Method Detail

      • getProjectRootDirectory

        File getProjectRootDirectory(File fileOrDirectory)
                      throws InvalidStructureException
        Finds the root directory of an existing project structure, given a file or directory inside the project structure. If the root directory could not be found - because the structure in the root directory was incorrect, because found POMs did not have correct parents or follow the required NamingStrategy etc. - an InvalidStructureException is thrown with a message indicating the exact reason.
        Parameters:
        fileOrDirectory - A file or directory within an existing project.
        Returns:
        The root directory of the project within which the supplied file or directory resides.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied dir File was not found within a project (i.e. a directory or file which has the returned File as an ancestor within its directory hierarchy). Also thrown if any of the required poms (reactor or parent) poms were not compliant with the namingStrategy.

      • getParentPomDirectory

        File getParentPomDirectory(File fileOrDirectory)
                    throws InvalidStructureException
        Finds the directory of the topmost parent pom within an existing project structure, given a file or directory inside the project structure. If the root directory could not be found - because the structure in the root directory was incorrect, because found POMs did not have correct parents or follow the required NamingStrategy etc. - an InvalidStructureException is thrown with a message indicating the exact reason.
        Parameters:
        fileOrDirectory - A file or directory within an existing project.
        Returns:
        The root directory of the project within which the supplied file or directory resides.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied dir File was not found within a project (i.e. a directory or file which has the returned File as an ancestor within its directory hierarchy). Also thrown if any of the required poms (reactor or parent) poms were not compliant with the namingStrategy.

      • getRelativePath

        String getRelativePath(File directory,
                       boolean usePackageSeparator)
                throws InvalidStructureException
        Retrieves the relative path for the supplied directory within the project.
        Parameters:
        directory - A directory which must have the Project Root Directory as a parent.
        usePackageSeparator - if true, the path returned will use PACKAGE_SEPARATORs, and otherwise DIRECTORY_SEPARATORs.
        Returns:
        The relative path between the project root directory and the supplied directory.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied dir File was not found within a project (i.e. a directory or file which has the returned File as an ancestor within its directory hierarchy), or if the
